title: Effective Design Strategies for Early Childhood Programming Education: Unplugged and Robotics Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced comprehension of programming fundamentals and instructional design principles
context.additional_context: Trainees are office/administrative professionals with practical experience in designing early childhood education programs; includes VR simulations to experience real early childhood education settings.

learning_goals: Develop two or more early childhood programming education scenarios by applying design principles of unplugged activities and robot-assisted instructional methods
Explain the effectiveness of programming education for young children from three aspects (cognitive ability, computational thinking, mathematical knowledge) based on meta-analysis research findings
Evaluate learning outcomes using educational effectiveness measurement methods in simulation/VR environments (e.g., observation checklists, behavioral analysis)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
